Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Metric

/--
Prove that there is a constant $C$ such that, if $p(x)$ is a polynomial of degree 1999, then \[|p(0)|\leq C \int_{-1}^1 |p(x)|\,dx.\]
-/
theorem putnam_1999_a5
: ∃ C : ℝ, ∀ p : Polynomial ℝ, p.degree = 1999 → ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ C * ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1999_a5
: ∃ C : ℝ, ∀ p : Polynomial ℝ, p.degree = 1999 → ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ C * ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
  use 1
  intro p hp
  have h₁ : p.degree = 1999 := hp
  have h₂ : ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
    -- Use the fact that the integral of the absolute value of p(x) over [-1, 1] bounds the value of p(0)
    have h₃ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 1
    have h₄ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 (-1)
    have h₅ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 2
    have h₆ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 (-2)
    simp_all [Polynomial.eval_zero]
    <;> norm_num
    <;> linarith [norm_nonneg (p.eval 0), norm_nonneg (p.eval 1), norm_nonneg (p.eval (-1)),
      norm_nonneg (p.eval 2), norm_nonneg (p.eval (-2))]
  simpa using h₂
```

import Mathlib

open Real Nat Topology MeasureTheory
open scoped BigOperators

theorem putnam_1999_a5
: ∃ C : ℝ, ∀ p : Polynomial ℝ, p.degree = 1999 → ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ C * ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
  use 1
  intro p hp
  have h₁ : p.degree = 1999 := hp
  have h₂ : ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
    -- Use the fact that the integral of the absolute value of p(x) over [-1, 1] bounds the value of p(0)
    have h₃ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 1
    have h₄ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 (-1)
    have h₅ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 2
    have h₆ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 (-2)
    simp_all [Polynomial.eval_zero]
    <;> norm_num
    <;> linarith [norm_nonneg (p.eval 0), norm_nonneg (p.eval 1), norm_nonneg (p.eval (-1)),
      norm_nonneg (p.eval 2), norm_nonneg (p.eval (-2))]
  simpa using h₂

Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Metric

/--
Prove that there is a constant $C$ such that, if $p(x)$ is a polynomial of degree 1999, then \[|p(0)|\leq C \int_{-1}^1 |p(x)|\,dx.\]
-/
theorem putnam_1999_a5
: ∃ C : ℝ, ∀ p : Polynomial ℝ, p.degree = 1999 → ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ C * ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1999_a5
: ∃ C : ℝ, ∀ p : Polynomial ℝ, p.degree = 1999 → ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ C * ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
  use 2
  intro p hp
  have h₁ : ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
    -- Use the fact that the polynomial is of degree 1999 to apply the Mean Value Theorem and find a point c where the derivative is bounded by the integral of the absolute value of the derivative.
    have h₂ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 1
    have h₃ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 (-1)
    simp [hp] at h₂ h₃
    norm_num at h₂ h₃
    -- Use the fact that the polynomial is of degree 1999 to apply the Mean Value Theorem and find a point c where the derivative is bounded by the integral of the absolute value of the derivative.
    <;>
    exact?
  -- Use the fact that the integral of the absolute value of the derivative is bounded by the integral of the absolute value of the polynomial.
  have h₂ : ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ ≥ ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
    linarith
  -- Combine the inequalities to show that the norm of p(0) is bounded by 2 times the integral of the absolute value of p(x).
  linarith
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1999_a5
: ∃ C : ℝ, ∀ p : Polynomial ℝ, p.degree = 1999 → ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ C * ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
  use 1
  intro p hp
  have h₁ : p.degree = 1999 := hp
  have h₂ : ‖p.eval 0‖ ≤ ∫ x in (-1)..1, ‖p.eval x‖ := by
    -- Use the fact that the polynomial has degree 1999 to show that the integral of the absolute value of p(x) over [-1, 1] is at least the value of p(0)
    have h₃ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 1
    have h₄ := p.sub_dvd_eval_sub 0 (-1)
    simp [hp] at h₃ h₄
    norm_num at h₃ h₄
    -- Use the fact that the polynomial has degree 1999 to show that the integral of the absolute value of p(x) over [-1, 1] is at least the value of p(0)
    <;>
      simp_all [hp, Int.norm_eq_abs, Int.cast_ofNat, Int.cast_neg, Int.cast_one]
    <;>
      linarith [abs_le.mp (h₃), abs_le.mp (h₄)]
  exact by simpa using h₂
```
